sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A sermon preached at the consecration of the right Reverend Father in God Barnaby Potter DD. and L. Bishop of Carlisle, at Ely house in Holbourne March 15. 1628. By Christopher Potter D.D. provost of Queenes Colledge in Oxford. Hereunto is added an advertisement touching the history of the quarrels of Pope Paul 5 with the Venetians; penned in Italian by F. Paul, and done into English by the former author Potter, Christopher, 1591-1646. Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623. Historia particolare delle cose passate tra'l sommo pontefice Paolo V. e la serenissima republica di Venetia. English. Selections.
[4], 127, [5] p.
Printed [By Miles Flesher] for Iohn Clarke, and are to be sold at his shop under St. Peters Church in Cornehill, London : 1629.
Printer's name from STC. The "Advertisement" is a translation from: Sarpi, Paolo. Historia particolare delle cose passate tra'l sommo pontefice Paolo V. e la serenissima republica di Venetia. The title page may be a cancel. The last two leaves are blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A sermon preached at the consecration of the right Reverend Father in God Barnaby Potter DD. and L. Bishop of Carlisle, at Ely house in Holbourne March 15. 1628. By Christopher Potter D.D. provost of Queenes Colledge in Oxford. Hereunto is added an advertisement touching the history of the quarrels of Pope Paul 5 with the Venetians; penned in Italian by F. Historia particolare delle cose passate tra'l sommo pontefice Paolo V. e la serenissima republica di Venetia. English. Selections.
[4], 127, [5] p.
Printed [By Miles Flesher] for Iohn Clarke, and are to be sold at his shop under St. Peters Church in Cornehill, London : 1629.
Printer's name from STC. The "Advertisement" is a translation from: Sarpi, Paolo. Historia particolare delle cose passate tra'l sommo pontefice Paolo V. e la serenissima republica di Venetia. The title page may be a cancel. The last two leaves are blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Iohn Clarke
Miles Flesher]
his shop under St. Peters Church in Cornehill
